clinical_study.brief_title: Morbimortality in Major Urgent General Surgery in the Geriatric Patient.
clinical_study.official_title: Morbimortality in Major Urgent General Surgery in the Geriatric Patient. Observational Study of Retrospective Cohort.

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

clinical_study.source: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

brief_summary.textblock:
Retrospective observational cohort study of geriatric patients operated of urgent major general surgery in our centre during 2018.
Our principal goals are:
1. To evaluate the incidence of post operation complications and its severity (defined by the Claiven-Dindo scale)
2. To evaluate the mortality: global mortality and mortality after: 30 days, 6 months and 1 year.

primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the incidence of post operation complications and its severity (defined by the Claiven-Dindo scale).
Global mortality and mortality after: 30 days, 6 months and 1 year.

secondary_outcome.description: "American College of Surgeons National Surgical Quality Improvement Program": % of death

intervention.description: All geriatric patients (75 years and over) going under urgent major general surgery during 2018 in our centre

study_pop.textblock: All the geriatric patients operated of urgent major general surgery in our centre during 2018.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Surgeries on the small and / or large bowel with or without intestinal resection, total colectomies, exploratory laparotomies
Exclusion Criteria:
- Polytraumatic patient, reoperations (for any cause) of scheduled and urgent surgeries
